{{cpp/chrono/duration/navbar}}
{{dcl begin}}
{{dcl|num=1|since=c++11|notes={{mark constexpr since c++17}}|
duration&amp; operator++();
}}
{{dcl|num=2|since=c++11|notes={{mark constexpr since c++17}}|
duration operator++( int );
}}
{{dcl|num=3|since=c++11|notes={{mark constexpr since c++17}}|
duration&amp; operator--();
}}
{{dcl|num=4|since=c++11|notes={{mark constexpr since c++17}}|
duration operator--( int );
}}
{{dcl end}}

Increments or decrements the number of ticks for this duration.

If {{tt|rep_}} is a member variable holding the number of ticks in a duration object, 
@1@ Equivalent to {{c|++rep_; return *this;}}.
@2@ Equivalent to {{c|return duration(rep_++)}}.
@3@ Equivalent to {{c|--rep_; return *this;}}.
@4@ Equivalent to {{c|return duration(rep_--);}}.

===Parameters===
(none)

===Return value===
@1,3@ A reference to this duration after modification.
@2,4@ A copy of the duration made before modification.

===Example===
{{example 
|code=
#include &lt;chrono&gt;
#include &lt;iostream&gt;

int main()
{
    std::chrono::hours h(1);
    std::chrono::minutes m = ++h;
    m--;
    std::cout &lt;&lt; m.count() &lt;&lt; " minutes\n";
}
|output=
119 minutes
}}
